metadata.title: CVE-2022-34479 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A malicious website that could create a popup could have resized the popupto overlay the address bar with its own content, resulting in potentialuser confusion or spoofing attacks.
*This bug only affects Thunderbirdfor Linux. Other operating systems are unaffected.*. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 102, Firefox ESR < 91.11, Thunderbird < 102, andThunderbird < 91.11. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34479` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
